author: Staff Reporter
text:
More modern cancer research institutes will ensure easy accessibility for patients and make treatment affordable, V. Shanta, chairman, Cancer Institute (WIA), Adyar, said on Sunday.

Speaking at a function organised by Bhagwan Mahaveer Foundation to honour her for being conferred with Padma Vibhushan, Dr. Shanta said, “Physicians should follow patient-centric approach. Cancer treatment should involve the patients and their family.”

J. Radhakrishnan, Health Secretary, stressed the need to bridge the gap between non-profit organisations that work in the healthcare sector and philanthropists, as contributions to such initiatives would benefit the needy and would reach a wider section of people. S.S. Badrinath, chairman, Sankara Nethralaya; Lata Krishna of Krishnaswamy Associates and S. Prasanchand Jain and N. Sugalchand Jain of the foundation spoke.
title: Need for more modern cancer institutes stressed
